title: Best SQLite editor so far..
comment: Just a request, maybe you can enable loading a BLOB (images) on BLOB types if you create the entry yourself. By default it is null and you cannot edit it unless there is already an existing BLOB.

Hi Eric,
That I need to fix! Until I have done that you can enter X’’ to add an empty BLOB (or set the default value for the BLOB field to X’’).
It might give me some troubles to fix it due to SQLite dynamic type system where you can find BLOB’s in all kind of fields as well as TEXT, INTEGER and REAL values in a field declared as a BLOB.
/Martin

title: Great tools
comment: Database manipulation come handy. Export to or import from CSV or SQL. Backup before processing and others great tools. And this app is function properly.. thanks dev..

Hi Affan,
Is it after an update statement you want it to prompt for commit? SQLite automatically commit changes made with an update statements unless you execute the "begin transaction" statement.
Best regards,
Martin

title: Very good
comment: Especially because it's free and does its job.

title: Excellent app but...
comment: User must switch tables or backout of the current database to force app to ask user to commit changes.  If you back up to opening dialog or exit app before committing, changes are lost.  App should provide a commit button or other proactive ui to commit and should warn user about losing changes before any action that would drop changes, e.g., exit, occurs.  A minor improvement would be to increase the list font size or at least provide the option.

Hi Jeff,
SQLite by default auto commit changes. You only have to commit (menu-transaction-commit) if you in the Query form have started a transaction (menu-transaction-begin transaction).
You can set font size for data list in the options.
/Martin

title: Keeps crashing.
comment: Could create a db & table, but crashes if I go to the table definition and click on a row with the hope of modifying it.

Hi Creig,
What should happen when tap on the SQL that define the table is that the SQL should be copied to the clip board. There is no alter table functionality in aSQLiteManager as SQLite only have very limited alter table functionality. I can't reproduce your problem on CM 4.4.2. If you send me the database I can see if it's a DB problem.
/Martin

I use SuperSU Free v2.40 and don't get that message. The changes in this update are minimal - a single bug fix for Android 5 and target changed to Android 5.0. Is it only using this you get the message?
/Martin

title: Great Database Manager App
comment: Awesome sqlite db app for Android. Clear and simple interface to manage tables and records and run SQL queries. I have added dbs by usb and even connected it with QPython3 for simple scripts. I highly recommend it for the data nerds out there.

In data view the row should be highlighted if I press my finger on the screen and trigger edit on long press. Or simply zoom the dataview (temporarily, I don't want to change font size to 25). Why? Because edit is a small target, with no hint I keep hitting one row up or down from my target. I also found a small bug: Open recent database doesn't work for databases needing root, it says can't find db.

Hi Dave,

The per data editing you would like is that editing a single field by long tap?
/Martin

title: Good, fast execution, easy to use.
comment: Executes my legacy SQLite queries. Export to CSV is good, but does not export field names (heard that donate version does);  does surround text with quotes making data easier to import to other applications. Font size, saving queries etc... all in Options. Would be good to be able to choose light/dark display. Good response from developer.

Hi Mike,
If you enable ”Save SQL” under options your SQL will be saved in a table called ”aSQLiteManager” and will be available through a ”Recent SQL” option. The option to include fieldnames to a CSV export exists in the donate version (where all new features appear first). I’ll add the light / dark theme option to my ToDo list.
/Martin

title: Decent app
comment: aSQLite, after the first few uses, appears to query well.  Must manually type complex queries.  Need more drop down options to accommodate.

Hi Len,
From the Query view you can generate select, create, drop, delete and insert statements by selecting ”Query type”, “Tables” and “Fields” from the menu. To do simple filtering use the filter builder from the Table view. To create new tables you can use the New Table wizard from the database view.
/Martin

This is a bug. You should be able to edit the field you tap on. Now it is only the last added field.
/Martin

title: Excessive permissions
comment: This app does not need all permissions to everything on my device.  Please remove unneeded permissions.

This app ask for 3 permissions:
WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE - needed to create new databases on the sdCard
WRITE_USER_DICTIONARY - needed to allow the user to add words to the dictionary
ACCESS_SUPERUSER - allow users with rooted phones to limit root access to app declaring this.
I cannot remove any of them without disabling functionality.
Martin

Martin

I can see your point. I store the history in the database as typical queries depends on the database. I could be up to the user to store the queries local or in a history database. /Martin

title: Best SQLite tool
comment: I tried several of the SQLite database tools available on Google Play, and this one (aSQLiteManager) was my favourite. It makes it surprisingly easy to edit large database tables on a tiny screen. It has a very useful feature to save any SQL queries that you run so that you can re-run them again in the future (you can even edit those queries since they're stored in their own SQLite table).

title: Works well
comment: This app has so far worked well and consistently. It took me a while to figure how to use the sql script feature. Initially when i would open a script file i wouldn't see the sql statements i knew were in the file and it would not run the script. It also did not give any errors. The problem turned out to be that i did not have semicolons at the end of my statements in the script file. As soon as i put the semicolons in i was able to see my sql statements when i opened the script file in the app.
Handy tool.

title: Amazing!
comment: The great advantage of this app, in my opinion, is the flexibility to work directly with SQL! Amazing! @willkrisz: You can edit/delete rows by query or using the button 'Edit' (first column). @Peter:You can add a row by query or using the button 'New' in the header (first column). @Developer: It would be helpful to have the 'Edit' button in the query results. [Samsung Galaxy 5 (i5500) - CyanogenMod 7.1 port by MadTeam]

title: good app but add some features pls
comment: I like this app. Works as expected. Great tool for managing browsers saved passwords. :) But would be good to have a quicker way to delete edit rows. It's unconformable to type sql commands on mobile. HTC Desire - oxygen 2.2.2

title: Needs more work
comment: Uninstalling because was not able to create a single table on a new database created with this same application. Buggy on my honeycomb asus transformer tablet, but i rate it 2 stars because it's a good idea and needed tool. Maybe in the future i will retry.

title: Why no root support?
comment: This app should support accessing root data itself, as aShell is buggy.
Works perfect! I'm able to edit all db files on my rooted Captivate.
Excellent, does exactly what it says. People whining about root need to go get remounting rw for dummies or read one of the thousands of tutorials.
Needs root support
/data directories can't be opened on purpose. The Android system does this to prevent your private data from being read by other apps. You need root.

comment: not able to edit in /data, can't actually do the test

Great app! Missing two things. Root access and a vertical scrollview instead of pg up and pg down.
Did exactly what I needed it to. Root not supported, would be great if it was an added feature.
Doesn't support root.

title: Good Manager
comment: Good sqlite manager. But the function I miss is the ability to INSERT new rows the existing tables. I can only edit the rows that are already created.
